metadata.synopsis: Nested dialogue. After impersonating a member of the player's camp (in camp or on entering the undercity), Orin reveals herself and delivers an ultimatum to the player: kill Gortash, or she will kill the abductee. Dark Urge players receive an alternate flow, where their shared background and rivalry is more present.

97.speaker: Orin
97.text: Look at it, crawling and sniffing and rooting around in the filth. Is it my Netherstone you seek, little piggy?
97.context: NodeContext: Just transformed/revealed herself. Mocking the player.

175.speaker: Orin
175.text: Hush, hush. Orin will take care of you. And your little pet.
175.context: NodeContext: Smug, feels she has the advantage. Not yet confirmed she's abducted the companion.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Murdering a child. What a wretched creature you are.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Snatching a child? Killing a defenceless animal? You're a wretched creature.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: What have you done with Gale?

24.speaker: Player
24.text: What have you done with Halsin?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: What have you done with Lae'zel?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: What have you done with Minthara?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: What have you done with Yenna?

145.speaker: Orin
145.text: Nothing, no not a thing! Still gasping and gagging on the foul airs of Bhaal's temple.
145.context: NodeContext: Feigning defensivenes/outrage - wanted you to think he's dead

137.speaker: Player
137.text: You're welcome to him. I'll get some peace and quiet at last.

202.speaker: Orin
202.text: Yes, yes it would be easy to snap his flapping jaw. Cut out his mouth meat and mute him for good. But not yet.
202.context: NodeContext: Like this is a funny idea, flash of violence but she puts the thought aside

182.speaker: Player
182.text: Keep him. He can bore you with his prattling instead.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: She's all yours. I never trusted her anyway.

127.speaker: Orin
127.text: Yes, yes such violence to be found in that one. Her blood boils hot and bitter, longing for release. But not yet.
127.context: NodeContext: Savouring the thought of killng the abductee, but puts the thought aside

102.speaker: Player
102.text: She was a liability. You've done me a favour.

199.speaker: Orin
199.text: You'd let me have her? She will make such tender meat for the slab. But not yet.
199.context: NodeContext: Savouring the thought of killng the abductee, but puts the thought aside

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Gortash warned me you'd try something like this.

170.speaker: Orin
170.text: Gortash. The Little Lord of Darkness. I know him well, yes yes and he knows me. Knows how my blades sculpt and carve this city.
170.context: NodeContext: Hates Gortash, asserting her own power in relation to his

53.speaker: Orin
53.text: I could peel a fine pelt from the mutt I caught sniffing at your heels. Drag skin from flesh from bone -
53.context: NodeContext: Continuing idea from previous line 'my blade sculpts and carves' - this is what her blade is capable of. Getting carried away with the idea, then about to pull herself back on the next line

74.speaker: Orin
74.text: I will not slice - his kind die too easily.
74.context: NodeContext: Bored by the thought, she has much more exciting things planned

83.speaker: Orin
83.text: The Murder Lord demands a better offering. A child of Bhaal. One whose veins pump with his poison.
83.context: NodeContext: 'child of Bhaal' referring to her nemesis, the Dark Urge, 'Murder Lord" = Bhaal. thinks you're holding out on her.

89.speaker: Orin
89.text: I know my slaughter kin is near. So does our Father. He wants to see us duel, to taste how we shred each other on his unholy soil.
89.context: NodeContext: Thinks you're holding out on her, Second sentence is key information - the terms of her ultimatum. Savouring the thought of killing the Dark Urge

125.speaker: Orin
125.text: But not yet, not until my kin proves worthy. The tyrant Gortash must be slaughtered. His Netherstone must be taken.
125.context: NodeContext: Key information - the terms of her ultimatum

6.speaker: Orin
6.text: The Murder Lord demands a better offering. Something new, sticky sweet and delicious. He wants you.
6.context: NodeContext: 'Murder Lord' = Bhaal. Savouring the thought.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: The Murder Lord wants me? Why?

139.speaker: Orin
139.text: Ketheric's killer. Turned the corpse-lover to carrion when you took his stone.
139.context: NodeContext: Referring back to the player killing Ketheric, one of Orin's co-conspirators. Amused by the fact you killed him. 'stone' refers to the netherstones Orin asks you to bring to her - important.

25.speaker: Orin
25.text: But he was a dull kill. No blood to spill, no guts to rip - a desiccated husk, all dust and hollow.

138.speaker: Orin
138.text: You must be sharpened before you set your edge against my skin.

155.speaker: Orin
155.text: Against the tyrant's throat, of course.
155.context: NodeContext: About to transform into Gortash, getting to her point

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Enough of these riddles. Speak plainly.

58.speaker: Orin
58.text: You'd prefer my whispers in the tyrant's tongue?
58.context: NodeContext: About to transform into Gortash, getting to her point

99.text: I had an arrangement with Lord Gortash. But he whinges and wails over the Crown, wanting to command it alone.
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin transforms into Gortash. She holds out a hand, inspects it, suppressing the distaste she feels even assuming his form.NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin

190.text: Oh how I long to slit his poxy smile from ear to ear. But I can't touch him. He bound my blade when we first conspired.
190.context: NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin

106.text: Gortash didn't want me at first. Didn't trust me. Got me to wag my tongue, swear an oath never to hang him from the hooks, drip-drain him into Father's open jaws...
106.context: NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin. Losing herself in daydreams about killing him.

35.text: You must kill the tyrant. Take the Netherstone from his corpse, and bring it to my temple.
35.context: NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin - urgent

122.speaker: Orin
122.text: There we slice and shred each other. The survivor claims the stones. What's left of the other is Bhaal's.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin reverts to her own formNodeContext: A glorious vision, Orin's idea of ecstasy. Mission explanation for the player.

206.speaker: Orin
206.text: Agree, and I will bring my assassins to heel. They watch you always, longing to spray the crimson from your veins.
206.context: NodeContext: with a leering threatening delight

140.speaker: Orin
140.text: Refuse me, and you'll learn what happens to those who defy Bhaal's doctrine. So will your friend.
140.context: NodeContext: as if wagging a finger to a naughty child (but actually threatening). 'your friend' refers to whoever she abducted from you

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: *Orin demands a fight to the death. The prize for the victor - the Netherstones, and the chance to control the crown alone.*

209.speaker: Narrator
209.text: *Accept, and you must kill Gortash. Refuse, and the child's life may be forfeit. As might your own - Orin's assassins will hunt you like prey for slaughter.*

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I have an alliance with Gortash. I will not break it.

124.speaker: Orin
124.text: The tyrant has you all twisted into knots, tight and tangled. Do you forget I have your meat strung on my hooks?
124.context: NodeContext: Pissed off that Gortash got to you first. 'Tyrant' is Gortash, 'meat on hooks' refers to the companion she abducted

10.speaker: Player
10.text: So you're stabbing your ally in the back? Or rather, asking me to.

64.speaker: Orin
64.text: Allies? No no. We had a balance, the Chosen three, but it tumbled when you turned the Bone Lord to ash. Now Gortash tries to gouge me from the city.
64.context: NodeContext: Never intended to be loyal to them, amused at how it's all fallen apart. Hates to even say Gortash's name.

57.speaker: Orin
57.text: That festering inadequate. Thinks me a flesher, butchering and cleaving only to whip the herd towards his tin men's oppression.
57.context: NodeContext: Angry/outraged - setting off all her insecurities

63.speaker: Orin
63.text: You must kill him. Gore him like a pig prepped for the spit. Only then you will be sweet and sharp, ready for the Murder Lord's purpose.
63.context: NodeContext: 'gore' is a play on the name Gortash - doesn't need heavy emphasis. A more vicious statement of the player's mission.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Sounds like you can't defeat Gortash without me. You need me.

157.speaker: Orin
157.text: Need? Nonono, I do not need. You are made of nothing, meaningless flesh and bone. I do not need. I offer.
157.context: NodeContext: Distancing herself from the player, establishing her power

174.speaker: Orin
174.text: Bhaal's age approaches, and you could be there to see it. An idol of flesh, made to welcome his bleeding dawn.
174.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks shocked, raises an eyebrow - you think I'll agree to this?NodeContext: Lost in the vision, rapturous

92.speaker: Orin
92.text: There is time for you yet. Time to save.
92.context: NodeContext: Teasing/tormenting - enjoying every moment. About to tell you how you can save your companion

49.speaker: Orin
49.text: Do not underestimate his Steel Watch. Seek their cradle in the Lower City and skewer their skull meat. Make them rust and blood. Then you can gore the lordling again and again and again -
49.context: NodeContext: Key info - delivering quest to seek out the steel watch foundry. Feigning generosity. Getting carried away with the thought of stabbing Gortash repeatedly.

59.speaker: Orin
59.context: NodeContext: About to deliver her ultimatum/threat, as though it's a secret

16.speaker: Orin
16.text: Step in my domain while the tyrant still sucks air, and I will carve your failure into your pretty plaything's skull.
16.context: NodeContext: These are her terms - important for the player to understand. Almost whispered, maybe a hint of glee towards the end

119.speaker: Orin
119.text: Bring me his stone, and I will set the bait free. Only then can the duel begin - my blood kin and I will create exquisite carnage. The victor will set the world to slaughter.
119.context: NodeContext: These are her terms - important for the player to understand.

80.speaker: Orin
80.text: Bring me his stone, and I will set the bait free. Only then can you and I make exquisite butchery. The victor will set the world to slaughter.
80.context: NodeContext: These are her terms - important for the player to understand. Believes she'll be the victor.

14.speaker: Orin
14.text: That is Bhaal's offer. He will not make another.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin disappears into the shadows.NodeContext: Final line - will disappear immediately after delivering it. True sense of Orin's threat here.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I'll kill Gortash with pleasure. Then I'm coming for you.

50.speaker: Orin
50.text: The promise of slaughter. Of pain and humiliation and the sound of blood drip-dropping into the gutter.
50.context: NodeContext: Amused/playful. Thrilled by the idea of the player killing Gortash, of him reduced to meat and blood - nothing.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I swear this. You'll be the next one dead at my feet. Not Gortash.

21.speaker: Orin
21.text: Your useless promise will drip wet and red from your ruptured jaw before I let you disobey Bhaal. My assassins will make sure of it.
21.context: NodeContext: Impoartant info - her assassins will attack the player after this point. 'Promise' referring to alliance with Gortash

142.speaker: Orin
142.text: The Murder Lord will not be denied. Neither will I.
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Final line - will disappear immediately after delivering it. True sense of Orin's threat here.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Swear no harm will come to Gale, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

159.speaker: Orin
159.text: Yes, oh yes. Kill the Banite, and I will keep my blade unblooded.
159.context: NodeContext: Agreeing not to harm abductee if player kills Gortash first. Making a fair deal.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Swear no harm will come to Halsin, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Swear no harm will come to Lae'zel, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Swear no harm will come to Minthara, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Swear no harm will come to Yenna, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Gale lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Halsin lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Lae'zel lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Minthara lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Yenna lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: Gortash can wait. I'm coming for you first, monster.

171.speaker: Orin
171.text: Silly, silly little slaughter hound. My assassins will not let you. If you hunt me, then they hunt you.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Gale.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Halsin.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Lae'zel.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Yenna.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Minthara.

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *Accept, and you must kill Gortash. Refuse, and your companion's life may be forfeit. As might your own - Orin's assassins will hunt you like prey for slaughter.*

100.text: You've heard Gortash's whispers - I see how your skull swarms with his promises. He whinges and wails over the Crown of Karsus, wanting to command it without me.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin transforms into Gortash. She inspects herself, suppressing the distaste she feels even assuming his form.NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin

176.speaker: Player
176.text: I'm sharp enough already. I'll show you right now.

66.speaker: Orin
66.text: No, no. Not here. Not now. The tyrant must fall first.
66.context: NodeContext: About to transform into Gortash, getting to her point

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Come for me, and you'll meet your god soon enough.

26.speaker: Orin
26.text: Silly little worm. My god is always with me. He shudders to see how my blades plunge into soft surrendered flesh.

78.speaker: Orin
78.text: Gortash's tyrant blood has cured your hide. You are almost fit for Bhaal's blade at last.
78.context: NodeContext: "You are ready" - like the player has no choice in this

62.speaker: Orin
62.text: We will be waiting for you, Chosen-killer.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Final line of flow - impactful. 'We' refers to abducted companion + Orin herself.

167.speaker: Orin
167.text: But it cannot be here. He must witness my domination. He must taste it. It must be in his Temple.
167.context: NodeContext: Key info - delivering her ultimatum.

130.speaker: Orin
130.text: Find me there. We will soak his soil with suffering. One claims the Netherstones, and one turns meat for the slab.
130.context: NodeContext: Key info - delivering her ultimatum.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: That's no god you hear. It's your own twisted imagination.

205.speaker: Orin
205.text: No, no, I am Bhaal's Chosen. He shows me glorious visions. Your flesh cleaved, your joints popped and broken. An altar slick with your sacrifice.
205.context: NodeContext: dreaming, in awe of these wonderful visions from Bhaal

95.speaker: Orin
95.text: But the dream... it flickers, I cannot focus on it. It is not yet complete. You must be made perfect. You must be sharpened.
95.context: NodeContext: explaining something frustrating, then realising the solution

184.speaker: Player
184.text: So does everybody else. I'm afraid he'll have to wait his turn.

29.speaker: Orin
29.text: The Murder Lord does not need permission to kill.

3.speaker: Orin
3.text: You are dull, a blunt blade unfit to flay. But you could be sharpened, thin and jagged... Yes - I will tell you what to do.
3.context: NodeContext: Fighting temptation to kill you where you stand. Building anticipation for the explanation she's about to give.

51.speaker: Orin
51.text: I will not slice - her kind die too easily.
51.context: NodeContext: Bored by the thought, she has much more exciting things planned

82.speaker: Orin
82.text: Do you drown in despair already? But there's so much more to do.

123.speaker: Orin
123.text: So eager to feel me drain its life away. Dull wits, dull blade. You are not yet ready.
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player draws their weapon/adopts a combat ready stance.

144.speaker: Orin
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aligns with the first node in each of the in-world abduction scenes. For example node N3 (UUID 71895db5-2701-4800-9bf3-14b2b3127dee) in LOW_BhaalTemple_InWorldAbduction_Gale. NodeContext: Orin giggles as she chases her 'victim'. It's a cruel, childish laugh - a predator playing with her food. The victim is actually Orin herself, so she's throwing her voice to make it sound like she's giving chase. Overall effect should be unsettling.

149.speaker: Orin
149.text: Look at it, Father's favourite all lost and wandering. Have you forgotten the way home?

150.speaker: Orin
150.text: You keep such silly little lambs in your flock. So easily slaughtered. Not like your green-gored friend. She loves the taste of blood too much.
150.context: NodeContext: Referring to the fact Orin-as-Lae'zel just murdered a child in front of the player. Then toying with the player, revealing she has taken Lae'zel too

46.speaker: Orin
46.text: Or did the child's little pet leave you no appetite for the main course? Do you not savour the slaughter of such innocence?
46.context: NodeContext: Referring to the fact Orin just convinced the player to unwittingly eat Yenna's cat, then toying with them - revealing she has taken Yenna

213.speaker: Orin
213.text: Should I set your lapdog to screaming? That could help you find the way.
213.context: NodeContext: Mocking. 'Lapdog' refers to abducted companion

91.speaker: Player
91.text: So Gortash spoke the truth. You've been following me.

204.speaker: Orin
204.text: The little lordling has been whispering in your ears? He always knew how to tumble and twist your mind matter, leave you knotted in his cords.
204.context: NodeContext: feigning surprise, mocking. Referring to player character's previous allegiance with Gortash

186.speaker: Orin
186.text: No matter. He is gored now. All maggot meal and bone-broken by your humbled butchery.
186.context: NodeContext: Gleeful at the thought of Gortash dead, but still can't resist criticising the player's killing of him

121.speaker: Orin
121.text: Better to be dull and brittle? A mind-mangled beast, no talent, no beauty in your atrocities.
121.context: NodeContext: Scoffing. Thinks the player is 'dull and brittle'. Second sentence is Orin's opinion of the player, not a continuation of the question

160.speaker: Orin
160.text: A blunt blade like you is not fit to carve Bhaal's glory. Thick-headed and foolish, to let the Banite's airs corrupt you.
160.context: NodeContext: Vicious, bitter - tapping into her deep loathing/jealousy of the player

192.speaker: Player
192.text: What have you done with Gale?

166.speaker: Player
166.text: What have you done with Halsin?

126.speaker: Orin
126.text: I will save him for you. We can peel his corpse together, once the Banite is dead.
126.context: NodeContext: Mocking, as thought you're good friends. 'Baneite' is Gortash.

179.speaker: Orin
179.text: Gortash betrays us, blood kin. He sets a leash to our slaughter, uses us to drive the herd towards his tin men's oppression.
179.context: NodeContext: General angry tone at the current state of affairs. Slightly reluctant to confess this to the player.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: What have you done with Lae'zel?

23.speaker: Player
23.text: What have you done with Minthara?

193.speaker: Orin
193.text: I will save her for you. We can peel her corpse together, once the Banite is dead.
193.context: NodeContext: Mocking, as thought you're good friends. 'Baneite' is Gortash.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: What have you done with Yenna?

200.speaker: Player
200.text: Kidnapping? Amateur. I'd have killed him already.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Kidnapping? Amateur. I'd have killed her already.

84.speaker: Orin
84.text: Bhaal's blood-addled beloved, swaddled in sinews, thinks it can judge?
84.context: NodeContext: Spitting, jealous - player immediately provoked her insecurities.

20.speaker: Orin
20.text: Never struggled, no purpose, nannied by that grim-gotten Butler. You are the one who isn't capable.
20.context: NodeContext: Spitting, jealous - player immediately provoked her insecurities. Reigning it in by the end (for transition to next node)

143.speaker: Orin
143.text: You must kill the tyrant, smear him across his rock-rotten halls, and pluck the Netherstone from his carcass.
143.context: NodeContext: Key info - player's mission. All in reference to killing Gortash

180.speaker: Orin
180.text: Then we duel, sweet slaughter-kin. The winner claims the stones - Bhaal's true Chosen. The loser rots on his altar.
180.context: NodeContext: Key info - Orin's demand of the Dark Urge (key to the player's arc). The way Orin will get what she craves (becoming Bhaal's true chosen)

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *So, this was Orin's intention. A combat against a fellow scion of Bhaal, witnessed by the Lord of Murder himself.*

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Bhaal made me his Slayer. I will become his Chosen too.

212.speaker: Orin
212.text: No no no. Filthy lies! He waits for me to carve domination into your ravaged skull. He will grind your meat in his jaws.
212.context: NodeContext: Desperate to believe this herself

133.speaker: Orin
133.text: Find me in Father's sanctum. We will set our cruelties against each other, and his true Chosen will rise.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Urgent, commanding. Last line before disappearing.

134.speaker: Orin
134.text: Face the Tribunal. Then he will taste your submission.
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears

104.speaker: Orin
104.text: But first, first, you must make gutspill of the tyrant.
104.context: NodeContext: Desperate, urgent - needs this more than anything

173.speaker: Player
173.text: I will not be Bhaal's Chosen. He cannot claim me.

67.speaker: Orin
67.text: His blood cannot be denied, slaughter kin. Neither can I.
67.context: NodeContext: Giggling - what a ridiculous thing to say

172.speaker: Player
172.text: My alliance with Gortash is restored. Give me your stone, and I'll let you live.

117.speaker: Orin
117.text: Is your brain so pulped? You suck up the tyrant's vapours like a babe sucks milk.
117.context: NodeContext: Disbelief - are you seriously that stupid?

93.speaker: Orin
93.text: Once you've remembered your place, seek out the Steel Watch's cradle in the Lower City. Skewer their skull meat, make them rust and blood. Then the lordling will be yours to butcher.
93.context: NodeContext: Important infortmation - giving a key step on the quest to kill Gortash, by destroying the steel watch foundry. Once they're gone, he'll be vulnerable

135.speaker: Orin
135.text: Come to my temple before you turn Gortash to carrion, and I will ready your friend's corpse to greet you.
135.context: NodeContext: Key info for player - if they do not do as Orin says, she will kill their companion

162.speaker: Orin
162.text: Bhaal is waiting, slaughter kin. Do not disappoint him.
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Smug, enjoying her power in the situation. Last line before disappearing.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Kill Gortash yourself, if you think you're truly Bhaal's Chosen.

136.speaker: Orin
136.text: That festering inadequate bound my blades when we first conspired. His crimson is not mine to spill. It must be you.
136.context: NodeContext: Key info - Orin is bound by her pact with Gortash, preventing her from harming him. She's really pissed about this - it puts her at a disadvantage

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Why wait? Let's kill each other right now.

118.speaker: Orin
118.text: You forget how Father's blood clots our veins. It must be returned to him, seeped straight into his grimborn jaws.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: A duel it is. I will extinguish Gortash. Then I will come for you.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: A duel it is. I am coming for you, Orin.

55.speaker: Orin
55.text: I witnessed your slipshod butchery. How you mauled the tyrant Gortash, turned him carcass for the crows. You are ready.
55.context: NodeContext: Mocking the player's method of killing Gortash. Judging you, but reluctantly confirming the importance of your actions.

71.speaker: Orin
71.text: Bhaal calls to us, his children. He would see us gouge and gut each other at last. A duel, our blood shed on his unholy soil.

177.speaker: Orin
177.text: But first, first you must be cleansed, bathed in the Murder Lord's sight. You must face his tribunal. Seek Grandfather's blessing.
177.context: NodeContext: Key info - instructing the player for the next part of their quest, to go to the murder tribunal.

103.speaker: Orin
103.text: Only then will you be permitted to return. Refuse, and I will slick Bhaal's sanctum with your plaything's sacrifice instead.
103.context: NodeContext: Key info - if you don't  obey her command, she will kill your companion

108.speaker: Player
108.text: A shame. I was looking forward to killing him myself.

110.speaker: Orin
110.text: Do not fear, slaughter kin. I will not set my blades to shredding yet.
110.context: NodeContext: Pretending to be on the same page as the player

151.speaker: Player
151.text: A shame. I was looking forward to killing her myself.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Murdering a child. What a wretched creature you are.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Snatching a child? Killing a defenceless animal? You're a wretched creature.

191.speaker: Orin
191.text: Look at it, brain battered and broken, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. Have you forgotten the way home, sibling?
191.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)
